trans-unit.source: Generate recommendations using Mahout and Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Generate recommendations using Mahout and Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Apache Mahout machine learning library to generate movie recommendations with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Apache Mahout machine learning library to generate movie recommendations with Linux-based HDInsight (Hadoop).

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the <linkText>Apache Mahout</linkText><title></title> machine learning library with Azure HDInsight to generate movie recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the <linkText>Apache Mahout</linkText><title></title> machine learning library with Azure HDInsight to generate movie recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Mahout is a <linkText>machine learning[ml]</linkText><title></title> library for Apache Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Mahout is a <linkText>machine learning[ml]</linkText><title></title> library for Apache Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Mahout contains algorithms for processing data, such as filtering, classification, and clustering.
trans-unit.target: Mahout contains algorithms for processing data, such as filtering, classification, and clustering.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will use a recommendation engine to generate movie recommendations that are based on movies your friends have seen.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will use a recommendation engine to generate movie recommendations that are based on movies your friends have seen.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document require a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster (preview).
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document require a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster (preview).

trans-unit.source: For information on using Mahout with a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Windows-based Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on using Mahout with a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Generate movie recommendations by using Apache Mahout with Windows-based Hadoop in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: A Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information about creating one, see <linkText>Get started using Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight[getstarted]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information about creating one, see <linkText>Get started using Linux-based Hadoop in HDInsight[getstarted]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: One of the functions that is provided by Mahout is a recommendation engine.
trans-unit.target: One of the functions that is provided by Mahout is a recommendation engine.

trans-unit.source: This engine accepts data in the format of userID, itemId, and prefValue (the users preference for the item).
trans-unit.target: This engine accepts data in the format of userID, itemId, and prefValue (the users preference for the item).

trans-unit.source: Mahout can then perform co-occurance analysis to determine: users who have a preference for an item also have a preference for these other items.
trans-unit.target: Mahout can then perform co-occurance analysis to determine: users who have a preference for an item also have a preference for these other items.

trans-unit.source: Mahout then determines users with like-item preferences, which can be used to make recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Mahout then determines users with like-item preferences, which can be used to make recommendations.

trans-unit.source: The following is an extremely simple example that uses movies:
trans-unit.target: The following is an extremely simple example that uses movies:

trans-unit.source: Co-occurance: Joe, Alice, and Bob all liked Star Wars, The Empire Strikes Back, and Return of the Jedi.
trans-unit.target: Co-occurance: Joe, Alice, and Bob all liked Star Wars, The Empire Strikes Back, and Return of the Jedi.

trans-unit.source: Mahout determines that users who like any one of these movies also like the other two.
trans-unit.target: Mahout determines that users who like any one of these movies also like the other two.

trans-unit.source: Co-occurance: Bob and Alice also liked The Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones, and Revenge of the Sith.
trans-unit.target: Co-occurance: Bob and Alice also liked The Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones, and Revenge of the Sith.

trans-unit.source: Mahout determines that users who liked the previous three movies also like these three.
trans-unit.target: Mahout determines that users who liked the previous three movies also like these three.

trans-unit.source: Similarity recommendation: Because Joe liked the first three movies, Mahout looks at movies that others with similar preferences liked, but Joe has not watched (liked/rated).
trans-unit.target: Similarity recommendation: Because Joe liked the first three movies, Mahout looks at movies that others with similar preferences liked, but Joe has not watched (liked/rated).

trans-unit.source: In this case, Mahout recommends The Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones, and Revenge of the Sith.
trans-unit.target: In this case, Mahout recommends The Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones, and Revenge of the Sith.

trans-unit.source: Conveniently, <linkText>GroupLens Research[movielens]</linkText><title></title> provides rating data for movies in a format that is compatible with Mahout.
trans-unit.target: Conveniently, <linkText>GroupLens Research[movielens]</linkText><title></title> provides rating data for movies in a format that is compatible with Mahout.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to download the data, then load it into the default storage for the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to download the data, then load it into the default storage for the cluster:

trans-unit.source: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The address to use when connecting is CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net and the port is 22.
trans-unit.target: The address to use when connecting is CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net and the port is 22.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH to connect to HDInsight, see the following documents:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH to connect to HDInsight, see the following documents:

trans-unit.source: Linux, Unix or OS X clients: See Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Linux, OS X or Unix
trans-unit.target: Linux, Unix or OS X clients: See Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Linux, OS X or Unix

trans-unit.source: Windows clients: See Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Windows
trans-unit.target: Windows clients: See Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Windows

trans-unit.source: Download the MovieLens 100k archive, which contains 100,000 ratings from 1000 users for 1700 movies.
trans-unit.target: Download the MovieLens 100k archive, which contains 100,000 ratings from 1000 users for 1700 movies.

trans-unit.source: Extract the archive using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Extract the archive using the following command:

trans-unit.source: This will extract the contents to a new folder named ml-100k.
trans-unit.target: This will extract the contents to a new folder named ml-100k.

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to copy the data to HDInsight storage:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to copy the data to HDInsight storage:

trans-unit.source: The data contained in this file has a structure of userID, movieID, userRating, and timestamp, which tells us how highly each user rated a movie.
trans-unit.target: The data contained in this file has a structure of userID, movieID, userRating, and timestamp, which tells us how highly each user rated a movie.

trans-unit.target: Use the following command to run the recommendation job:

trans-unit.source: The job may take several minutes to complete, and may run multiple MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: The job may take several minutes to complete, and may run multiple MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: Once the job completes, use the following command to view the generated output:
trans-unit.target: Once the job completes, use the following command to view the generated output:

trans-unit.source: The output will appear as follows:
trans-unit.target: The output will appear as follows:

trans-unit.source: The first column is the userID.
trans-unit.target: The first column is the userID.

trans-unit.source: The values contained in '[' and ']' are movieId:recommendationScore.
trans-unit.target: The values contained in '[' and ']' are movieId:recommendationScore.

trans-unit.source: Some of the other data contained in the ml-100k directory can be used to make the data more user friendly.
trans-unit.target: Some of the other data contained in the ml-100k directory can be used to make the data more user friendly.

trans-unit.target: This will look at the recommendations generated for user ID 4.

trans-unit.source: The u.data file is used to retrieve movies that the user has rated
trans-unit.target: The u.data file is used to retrieve movies that the user has rated

trans-unit.source: The u.item file is used to retrieve the names of the movies
trans-unit.target: The u.item file is used to retrieve the names of the movies

trans-unit.source: The recommendations.txt is used to retrieve the movie recommendations for this user
trans-unit.target: The recommendations.txt is used to retrieve the movie recommendations for this user

trans-unit.source: The output from this command will be similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The output from this command will be similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Mahout jobs do not remove temporary data that is created while processing the job.
trans-unit.target: Mahout jobs do not remove temporary data that is created while processing the job.

trans-unit.source: The --tempDir parameter is specified in the example job to isolate the temporary files into a specific path for easy deletion.
trans-unit.target: The --tempDir parameter is specified in the example job to isolate the temporary files into a specific path for easy deletion.

trans-unit.source: To remove the temp files, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To remove the temp files, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: If you do not remove the temporary files or the output file, you will receive a 'cannot overwrite file' error message if you run the job again with the same --tempDir path.
trans-unit.target: If you do not remove the temporary files or the output file, you will receive a 'cannot overwrite file' error message if you run the job again with the same --tempDir path.
